yea I was about to say the same..

on rock music, a few I recommend for butt-kicking bass [most real hard and agressive, unlike rap or hip hop]:

KoRn - Alone I Break

KoRn - Twisted Transistor

KoRn - Another Brick in the Wall

KoRn - Ball Tongue

KoRn - Got the Life

Nightwish - Bye Bye Beautiful

Three Days Grace - The Animal I Have Become

Joe Anderson - Hey Jude <-- Will blow your woofer by the end of the song

Angels and Airwaves - Everything's Magic

Angels and Airwaves - The Adventure

Apocalyptica - Hall of the Mountain King

Barrio Zumba - Mexicano <-- THIS is bass

Disturbed - Perfect Insanity

Disturbed - Stupify

Disturbed - Down With the Sickness

Disturbed - Inside the Fire

Disturbed - Divide

Disturbed - Facade

Disturbed - Haunted

Marilyn Manson - Vodevil

Marilyn Manson - Doll-Dagga Buzz-Buzz Ziggetty-Zag

Marilyn Manson - The Fight Song [Slipknot Remix]

Marilyn Manson - Irresponsible Hate Anthem

Rammstein - Fever Frei!

Rammstein - Ohne Dich

System of a Down - Violent Pournougrafi

System of a Down - Question!

Not rock but DAMN good bass:

ANY song from Fionna Apple

-Sally's Song

-Criminal

-Oh Wel

-Extraordinary Machine

But here's the thing... I've played rap, techno... pretty much the songs here and nope.. there is still this one song that beats the hell out of any song. It's reggaeton... Don Omar - Conteo. If anyone can play it, see for yourself, and I'm looking for a song that can beat this one [rock preferably]. It's a constant bass shaking experience, the frequency change makes the harmonics go back and forth, giving you this feeling that it's all moving, not just the boom boom boom of a techno song or a rap song... no no, this is different. Subsonic range, dunno the freq but it's got a nice range.

}

That's tested in 2 VERY different amps/woofers.
